choices: No outlet. Road will end ahead

choices: That he is preparing to slow down or stop
That he plans to turn left
That he plans to turn right

choices: You cannot turn left from this lane
You can turn left or go straight through

questions.question: When approaching within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way two-lane highway, you must:

choices: Legal if it is a drug prescribed by your physician
Legal if it is a prescription drug or an over-the-counter drug

questions.question: In which of the following cases will your driver's license be revoked?
choices: Fail to carry insurance on your vehicle
Fail to stop for a school bus
Lying about the ownership of a car you are driving

questions.question: You are driving on a freeway. If you feel at all sleepy, you should:

choices: Ask the rider to lie down
Cover the rider with a blanket or coat

choices: The rule gives you time and distance to respond to problems
The distance in yards does not change with different speeds
You can use the same rule no matter road or weather conditions

questions.question: This sign tells you that the center lane must be used for:

choices: Is required to stop at all railroad crossings

questions.question: When making a right turn, you must:
choices: Drive close to the center divider line or left edge of the road

questions.question: What does this sign mean?

Hydroplaning occurs:
choices: When your tires lose traction on wet pavement

questions.question: A blue and white sign at a railroad crossing indicates:
choices: What to do if there is an emergency on or near the tracks
That you must slow down to 15 mph or less
That you must always come to a full stop

questions.question: What is true about seat belts?
choices: They are not required in trucks and SUVs

They are not required in residential areas

choices: Speed up to find a gap in your exit lane
Not use your turn signal until you exit
Start slowing down in the deceleration lane

questions.question: When you drive through a construction zone, you should:
choices: Be prepared to slow down or stop
Slow down to watch the ongoing work
Decrease distance between you and any car ahead

questions.question: When driving in fog, it is a good idea to:
choices: Flash your high-beam headlights when you see oncoming vehicles
Reduce distractions by turning off the radio and cell phone

questions.question: Unless posted otherwise, what is the speed limit in municipal speed areas?
What does this sign mean?
Where do most traffic crashes occur?

choices: Stop and remain stopped until gates open and lights stop flashing
Stop and wait until the gates close, then drive carefully around the gates
Speed up and pass the crossing before the gates close

questions.question: Drivers entering a roundabout:
choices: Must yield to drivers already in the roundabout
Have the right of way if they arrive first

questions.question: What shape is a road sign that tells you a school crossing is ahead?

choices: A red arrow is about to appear
Permitted turn, yield, and proceed with caution
A protected turning period will begin

questions.question: What does this sign mean?

If your car has airbags, you should:
choices: Only use seat belts when driving at speeds over 50 mph
Only use seat belts when driving long distances

questions.question: When driving in heavy rain, you should use the following:
Parking on the roadside of another parked vehicle (double park):
choices: Is allowed, unless there is a sign that prohibits parking
Is allowed on a one-way street

questions.question: When following a large truck that blocks your view ahead, you should:
choices: Drive up as closely as possible

questions.question: This traffic sign warns you of:

choices: An insurance under Florida Financial Responsibility Law
An insurance under Florida No-Fault Law
An insurance that at least covers Personal Injury Protection (PIP)

questions.question: At a traffic signal showing a green light, you must yield to other vehicles:
choices: If they have already entered the intersection
Only if they are approaching from your right
In no situation, the green light gives you the right-of-way

questions.question: After a crash, your car plunges into deep water. You manage to escape through a window. What should you do next?
choices: Swim away as quickly as possible
Climb onto the top of the vehicle
Stay in the water, close to your vehicle

questions.question: Illegal drugs and controlled substances, such as marijuana:
choices: Will keep you awake and alert for long periods
Affect a person's reflexes, judgment, and alertness
Does not affect your driving skills at all

questions.question: When a traffic signal is showing a red arrow:
choices: Remain stopped until a green signal or a green arrow appears
After stopping, you may turn from a one-way street into a one-way street
You may always turn left or right after stopping and yielding

The driver in front of you signals (left arm extended, with elbow bent upward, at about a 90-degree angle):
choices: That he is preparing to slow down or stop
That he plans to turn left
That he plans to turn right

questions.question: On which side should you pass a vertical panel like this?

choices: Is safe if you keep three feet or more
Is safe where the speed limit is 40 mph or less

choices: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways
There will be fewer lanes ahead
The divided highway on which you are traveling ends ahead

questions.question: Which is true about tailgating (following another vehicle too closely)?
choices: It is the cause of most rear-end accidents
It makes it easier to see signs of problems ahead
It gives you enough time to stop or avoid a hazard

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of defensive driving?
choices: Wait until other drivers make a move to avoid a dangerous situation
Change your driving to fit weather conditions
Keep your eyes focused straight ahead

questions.question: If you are driving in a lane where the lane use signal shows a yellow X, you should:
choices: Come to a full stop ahead
Stay in the lane and turn left ahead

questions.question: When should you use your high-beam headlights?
choices: At night and when approaching another vehicle from behind

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: When turning left or right, you must wait for a green arrow to appear
When the light is red, you may not turn right or left
When the light is green, you must continue straight

questions.question: What is the best advice for a driver who has been drinking alcohol?
choices: To drink less than an hour before the drive
To arrange for a designated driver, use public transportation or call a cab

questions.question: A driver turns at an intersection without traffic lights, and a pedestrian prepares to cross. Who must yield?

choices: A bell, siren, or exhaust whistle

What is true about stopping at a railroad crossing?
choices: You must always stop, even if no train is approaching
You must stop only if a gate is lowered
You must stop if a flagman is signaling the approach of a train

questions.question: If you are in a roundabout when an emergency vehicle with flashing lights approaches from behind, you should:
choices: Proceed through the roundabout before stopping
Proceed through the roundabout and continue driving
Move to the right in the roundabout and stop

choices: May need to stop to avoid blocking the intersection

questions.question: When you arrive at a traffic signal showing a steady red light, you must:
choices: Come to a complete stop, unless turning right
Come to a complete stop, unless turning left

questions.question: When driving on slippery roads, you should:
choices: Drive slightly faster than the speed limit
Increase distance between you and any vehicle ahead
Drive as you would on dry roads

questions.question: What is true about motorcycles?
choices: They don't have the same rights and responsibilities as other motorists
Because of their size, they may appear to be much closer than they really are
They often appear to travel faster than they are

questions.question: If you must stop in thick fog, it is essential to:
choices: Signal, then carefully pull off as far as possible
Stay on the traveled portion of the highway
Not to distract other drivers by using your turn signal

questions.question: When you park on a hill headed uphill, and there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels:
choices: Parallel to and at least 12 inches away from the side of the road
Toward the side of the road
Parallel to and touching the curb

questions.question: When you stop at a railroad crossing, you must keep the following minimum distance to the nearest rail:

Anti-lock brakes reduce the chances of a skid occurring, particularly when:

choices: All approaching traffic to this intersection must stop
You must give the right-of-way to pedestrians and vehicles

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
When should you use your parking lights?
If it feels like your tires have lost traction with the surface of the road (hydroplaning), you should:
choices: Ease your foot off the gas pedal
Brake and turn off the road

questions.question: Drivers must obey traffic control signals, except when:
choices: The way is clear, and it is safe to proceed

questions.question: If school bus with flashing red lights has stopped on a highway divided by a physical barrier, you must:
choices: Stop only when children are crossing the road
Stop when approaching the school bus from behind

questions.question: You can drive in the bike lane:
choices: When preparing for a right turn

questions.question: A five-sided sign means:

choices: Improve vision and ability to adjust to glare
Impair a person's reflexes, judgment, and alertness
Help you make fewer mistakes when driving

questions.question: What is true about signaling before suddenly reducing speed?
choices: It is not necessary to signal when you suddenly reduce speed
You may use hand-and-arm signals when visibility is good
You must always use the vehicle's emergency lights

questions.question: A pedestrian has entered a crosswalk where there are no signs or signals. Who has the right of way?
choices: A motor vehicle should have the right-of-way since there are no stop signs or traffic signals
It depends on who reached the crossing first
The pedestrian should have the right-of-way

questions.question: Which pavement marking separates lanes with traffic going in the same direction?
Who will get a ticket if a front-seat passenger 18 years or older is not wearing a seat belt?
choices: Both the driver and the passenger

questions.question: This road sign tells you that:
choices: You must not enter in the direction you are going
The road ahead will not have a hard-surfaced pavement
There is road work ahead and you must take a detour
